question: Shimmy is often prevented in light single nose wheel aircraft by?
explanation:
Due to the flexibility of tyre side walls, an unstable, rapid sinusoidal oscillation or vibration
known as shimmy is induced into the nose undercarriage.
Excessive shimmy, especially at high speeds, can set up vibrations throughout the aircraft and
can be dangerous.
Worn or broken torque links, wear in the wheel bearings and uneven tyre pressures can all
increase the tendency to shimmy.
Shimmy can be reduced in several ways:
• Provision of a hydraulic lock across the steering jack piston.
• Fitting a hydraulic damper.(shimmy damper)
• Fitting heavy self-centring springs.
• Double nose wheels.
• Twin contact wheels.
subject: Technical
